conclusion: Understanding the flow of liquid through baffles to predict its direction into containers E and F.
Baffles A, B, C, and D are shown in the image with arrows indicating the direction of liquid flow.
Baffle A is blue and flows from left to right.
Baffle B is gray and flows from left to right.
Baffle C is yellow and flows from left to right.
Baffle D is green and flows from left to right.
Liquid will pass through baffles A, B, C, and D, being deflected by each before reaching containers E and F.
Direction of liquid after each baffle is influenced by the angle and orientation of the baffle.
After passing through baffle A, the liquid will be deflected to the right.
After passing through baffle B, the liquid will be deflected further to the right.
After passing through baffle C, the liquid will be deflected even more to the right.
After passing through baffle D, the liquid will be deflected to the right again.
Liquid deflected to the right by each baffle will ultimately flow into container F.
The final answer is container F.
